RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Windows" group that is maintained by the 1.1 OS Classification\Windows sub-policy. All detected Windows devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
When Windows devices are not manageable by CounterACT the remaining sub-policies use various available attributes to separate possible corporate machines needing maintenance from suspected guests and known unauthorized windows devices.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "Managed Windows Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
RULE.NAME: (Windows Enterprise Manageability)

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Machines managed via the Host Property Scanner Domain Credentials are added the "Managed Windows Devices" group.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Domain Managed

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This rule identifies unmanaged machines that have been manually approved and exempted by a CounterACT administrator via the "Exempt-Approved Windows Devices" group.
This should be used when a known quantity Windows machine must remain on the network but cannot be managed (technical or political justification).
INNER_RULE.NAME: Manually Approved Windows Devices

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Machines that are using the correct NetBIOS domain/workgroup name, but are not manageable via domain credentials and have not been verified as actual Domain members will be identified by this policy.
These can include: - Machines with broken Domain accounts (need to be re-joined - Machines impersonating the domain name, but are in a Workgroup. - Misconfigured lab or test machines
These should be investigated and legitimate machines remediated.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Corp NetBIOS Domain

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This sub-policy identifies misc. NetBIOS domain and workgroup names that have been discovered on the network.
Authorized Domain names may need to be separated from this rule in a similar fashion to the Corp NetBIOS Domain Name sub-policy.
This allows for tracking a baseline of machines in non-standard Domains that must exist on the network.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Misc NetBIOS Domain Names

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
The remaining Windows devices that have not provided enough properties for host Clarification or events detected on the SPAN interface.
This is typically the one of the first places to begin enforcement/remediation actions.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Unknown Windows Machines
Firewall Agent Installed, but Service Not Running
Patching Agent Installed, but Service Not Running

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the endpoint: • 'Wired AutoConfig' service is not running When this condition is true, the endpoint is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true for the supplicant installed on the endpoint: • 'Enable IEEE 802.1X authentication' configuration is not enabled When this condition is true, the endpoint is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: 802.1X Authentication Not Enabled

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if both of the following are true for the supplicant installed on the endpoint: • Network authentication method is not 'PEAP' • Network authentication method is not 'Smart Card or other certificate' When both of these conditions are true, the endpoint is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: Required Authentication Method Not Selected

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: When the inspected endpoint does not match any of the preceding policy sub-rules, the endpoint is considered: • Ready for 802.1X authentication.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Endpoint Is Ready

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Macintosh" group that is maintained by the 1.1 OS Classification\Macintosh sub-policy. All detected Macintosh devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
If Macintosh devices are not manageable by CounterACT via either SSH key or SecureConnector, or manually approved via an Exemption, the policy will separate them into hosts with port 22 available, but not manageable and hosts with no management port open.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "ManagedMacintosh Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
RULE.NAME: (Mac OS OS Manageability)

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Endpoints matching this sub-rule had their authentication rejected by the RADIUS server. CAUSE: Either computer-supplied or user-supplied credentials did not match the credentials in the Active Directory of the domain.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Invalid Credentials Supplied

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Endpoints matching this sub-rule had their authentication rejected by the external RADIUS server. When CounterACT acts as a proxy to an external RADIUS server, the cause of rejected authentications cannot be determined.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Rejected by External RADIUS Server

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Endpoints matching this sub-rule attempted MAC address bypass (MAB) and were rejected by the CounterACT RADIUS server. CAUSE:The endpoint MAC address was not listed in the MAC Address Repository (MAR) of the 802.1X Plugin. The MAR is the plugin's repository of endpoints that authenticate using MAB.
INNER_RULE.NAME: MAC Bypass Rejected

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Endpoints matching this sub-rule had their authentication rejected by the CounterACT RADIUS server. CAUSE: The domain controller did not provide an adequate response to the RADIUS server.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Domain Controller Detected Error

VALUE.VALUE2: Invalid output from ntlm_auth: expecting NT_KEY

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Endpoints matching this sub-rule had their authentication rejected by the CounterACT RADIUS server. CAUSE: The endpoint supplicant did not trust the certificate authority that issued the RADIUS server's server certificate.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Server Certificate Issuer Not Trusted

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Endpoints matching this sub-rule had their authentication rejected by the CounterACT RADIUS server. CAUSE: The RADIUS server did not trust the certificate authority that issued the endpoint supplicant's client certificate.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Client Certificate Issuer Not Trusted

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Endpoints matching this sub-rule had their authentication rejected by the CounterACT RADIUS server. CAUSE: The endpoint supplicant stopped the TLS handshake with the RADIUS server. This might indicate that the server certificate is invalid.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Client Issued TLS Alert

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Endpoints matching this sub-rule had their authentication rejected by the CounterACT RADIUS server. CAUSE: The RADIUS server stopped the TLS handshake with the endpoint supplicant. This might indicate that the client certificate is invalid.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Server Issued TLS Alert

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Endpoints matching this sub-rule had their authentication rejected by the CounterACT RADIUS server. CAUSE: The EAP negotiation between the RADIUS server and the endpoint supplicant stopped for a reason not covered by any of the preceding sub-rules. For example, the two parties did not agree on the EAP method.
INNER_RULE.NAME: EAP Negotiation Failure

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Endpoints matching this sub-rule had their authentication accepted by the RADIUS server, however, endpoint access was then denied by the defined authorization imposed on them by the RADIUS server.
A denial of access has any one of the following CounterACT sources: • Policy action authorization • MAR authorization • Pre-Admission authorization rule
INNER_RULE.NAME: Denied By Authorization

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Endpoints matching this sub-rule had their authentication rejected by the CounterACT RADIUS server. CAUSE: The authentication stopped for a reason not matched by any of the preceding sub-rules.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Other Rejections

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'aaa authentication dot1x...' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'dot1x system-auth-control' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'radius-server host <IP address>' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication .

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'radius-server...key <string>' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: Key Between Switch and RADIUS Not Configured

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'radius-server vsa send' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Ready for 802.1X authentication • Switch is unable to use VSAs for authorization, for example, ACLs.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Using VSA Not Enabled

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'aaa server radius dynamic-author' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Ready for 802.1X authentication • Switch is unable to respond to re-authentication (CoA) requests initiated by the plugin.
INNER_RULE.NAME: RADIUS Re-Authentication Not Configured

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: When the inspected switch does not match any of the preceding policy sub-rules, the switch is considered: • Ready for 802.1X authentication.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Switch Configuration Ready

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's port is not open for this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Port Not Open - SSH

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are known to CounterACT as the default credentials for this device using this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Factory Default Credentials - SSH

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Factory Default, Communication Protocol:SSH

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are included in the custom credential list for this protocol in CounterACT Options > IoT Posture Assessment Engine.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Custom Credentials - SSH

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Custom List, Communication Protocol:SSH

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are known to CounterACT as commonly used credentials that are likely to be compromised during a brute-force attack using this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Commonly Used Credentials - SSH

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Commonly Used, Communication Protocol:SSH

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials using this protocol are not known to CounterACT.
INNER_RULE.NAME: No Known Credential - SSH
Port Not Open OR Active Inspection Blocked
